description:
Christine Doig Cardet
----------------------
Data Scientist
----------------------

https://www.facebook.com/christine.doig.12
https://www.linkedin.com/in/christinedoigcardet/
https://twitter.com/ch_doig
https://github.com/chdoig

----------------------

Keynote Speaker at PyCon Colombia 2018
Data Science past, present and future
--------------------------------------------
Christine Doig.

I love empowering people through data science and open source technology.

5+ years of professional experience in analytics, operations research, and machine learning in a variety of industries, including energy, manufacturing, banking and defense. Worked with a variety of software and programming languages, including Matlab, Excel, SAS, R, Python and Hadoop. Adaptive and always eager to learn. Thrived in cross-functional teams with Engineering, Product, UX, Sales and Marketing. Empathetic and good listener.

Speaker and trainer at many Open Source conferences, including PyCon, EuroPython, SciPy, and OSCON, and local meetups, such as ACM SIGKDD Austin, PyBCN and PyLadies. Topics include: Interactive Data Visualization, Machine Learning, Topic Modeling, Data Science Reproducibility, Best Practices and Ecosystem Overview. Excellent storytelling skills and great at presenting complex subjects to non-technical and beginner audiences. Occasional blogger, writer and webinar presenter.

M.S. in Industrial Engineering from the Polytechnic University of Catalonia in Barcelona. Master Thesis at RWTH Aachen, Germany. Lived in three different countries (U.S., Spain and Germany) and proficient in four languages (English, Spanish, Catalan and German). Love traveling and movies.
About PyCon Colombia 2018
--------------------------------------------------
We are excited to share this overview of the second edition of Colombia’s Python Conference: PyCon Colombia 2018  - http://bit.ly/overview-pyconcolombia2018
We want to say thanks to all our sponsors who helped make the conference a huge success.

Join us at our next conference, February 8 - 10, 2019 in Bogota, Colombia.  More information in http://www.pycon.co
